attributes.action: Free prescription for life saving drugs for asthmatic's
attributes.additional_details:
5.4 million people in the UK are currently receiving treatment for asthma: 1.1 million children (1 in 11) and 4.3 million adults (1 in 12)

Taking  asthma medicines regularly as prescribed is the best way to prevent asthma symptoms and a potentially life-threatening asthma attack. So without these we are at risk. There are many conditions who have a valid medical exemption certificate (MedEx) and are entitled to free prescriptions but not asthmatic's, we also need life saving drugs.
attributes.background:
There are 5.4 million people with asthma in the UK, which means asthma affects one in every 11 people and one in five households. 
Three people a day die from asthma.
